trans-unit.source: Tell me about virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Tell me about virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Azure Virtual Machines lets you create and use virtual machines in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure Virtual Machines lets you create and use virtual machines in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Providing what's known as *Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)*, virtual machine technology can be used in variety of ways.
trans-unit.target: Providing what's known as *Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)*, virtual machine technology can be used in variety of ways.

trans-unit.source: Some examples are:
trans-unit.target: Some examples are:

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines (VMs) for development and test.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines (VMs) for development and test.

trans-unit.source: Development groups commonly use VMs because they offer a quick, easy way to create a computer with specific configurations required to code and test an application.
trans-unit.target: Development groups commonly use VMs because they offer a quick, easy way to create a computer with specific configurations required to code and test an application.

trans-unit.source: Azure Virtual Machines provides a straightforward and economical way to create these VMs, use them, then delete them when they're no longer needed.
trans-unit.target: Azure Virtual Machines provides a straightforward and economical way to create these VMs, use them, then delete them when they're no longer needed.

trans-unit.source: Running applications in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Running applications in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: It makes economic sense to run some applications in the public cloud.
trans-unit.target: It makes economic sense to run some applications in the public cloud.

trans-unit.source: One example is an application that has large spikes in demand.
trans-unit.target: One example is an application that has large spikes in demand.

trans-unit.source: Although you could equip your own data center with enough hardware to handle peak demand, that hardware might be underutilized much of the time.
trans-unit.target: Although you could equip your own data center with enough hardware to handle peak demand, that hardware might be underutilized much of the time.

trans-unit.source: Running this application on Azure lets you pay for extra VMs only when you need them and shut them down when you don't.
trans-unit.target: Running this application on Azure lets you pay for extra VMs only when you need them and shut them down when you don't.

trans-unit.source: Or, suppose you're a start-up that needs on-demand computing resources quickly and with no commitment.
trans-unit.target: Or, suppose you're a start-up that needs on-demand computing resources quickly and with no commitment.

trans-unit.source: Once again, Azure can be the right choice.
trans-unit.target: Once again, Azure can be the right choice.

trans-unit.source: Extending your own datacenter into the public cloud.
trans-unit.target: Extending your own datacenter into the public cloud.

trans-unit.source: When you use Azure Virtual Network, your organization can create a virtual network (VNET) that's an extension of your own on-premises network and add VMs to that VNET.
trans-unit.target: When you use Azure Virtual Network, your organization can create a virtual network (VNET) that's an extension of your own on-premises network and add VMs to that VNET.

trans-unit.source: This allows running applications such as [SharePoint](virtual-machines-sharepoint-infrastructure-services.md), [SQL Server](virtual-machines-sql-server-infrastructure-services.md) and others on an Azure VM.
trans-unit.target: This allows running applications such as [SharePoint](virtual-machines-sharepoint-infrastructure-services.md), [SQL Server](virtual-machines-sql-server-infrastructure-services.md) and others on an Azure VM.

trans-unit.source: This approach might be easier to deploy or less expensive than running them in VMs your own datacenter.
trans-unit.target: This approach might be easier to deploy or less expensive than running them in VMs your own datacenter.

trans-unit.source: Disaster recovery.
trans-unit.target: Disaster recovery.

trans-unit.source: Rather than paying continuously for a backup datacenter that's rarely used, IaaS-based disaster recovery lets you pay for the computing resources you need only when you really need them.
trans-unit.target: Rather than paying continuously for a backup datacenter that's rarely used, IaaS-based disaster recovery lets you pay for the computing resources you need only when you really need them.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your primary datacenter goes down, you can create VMs running on Azure to run essential applications, then shut them down when they're no longer needed.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your primary datacenter goes down, you can create VMs running on Azure to run essential applications, then shut them down when they're no longer needed.

trans-unit.source: Like other virtual machines, a VM in Azure has an operating system, storage and networking capabilities and can run a wide variety of applications.
trans-unit.target: Like other virtual machines, a VM in Azure has an operating system, storage and networking capabilities and can run a wide variety of applications.

trans-unit.source: You can use an image provided by Azure or one of it's partners, or use your own.
trans-unit.target: You can use an image provided by Azure or one of it's partners, or use your own.

trans-unit.source: Examples include various versions, editions and configurations of:
trans-unit.target: Examples include various versions, editions and configurations of:

trans-unit.source: Windows Server
trans-unit.target: Windows Server

trans-unit.source: Linux servers such as Suse, Ubuntu and CentOS
trans-unit.target: Linux servers such as Suse, Ubuntu and CentOS

trans-unit.source: SQL Server
trans-unit.target: SQL Server

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Server
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Server

trans-unit.source: SharePoint Server
trans-unit.target: SharePoint Server

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines use virtual hard disks (VHDs) to store their operating system (OS) and data.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines use virtual hard disks (VHDs) to store their operating system (OS) and data.

trans-unit.source: VHDs are also used for the images you can choose from to install an OS.
trans-unit.target: VHDs are also used for the images you can choose from to install an OS.

trans-unit.source: VMs can be managed using a browser-based portal, command-line tools with support for scripting, or directly through the REST API.
trans-unit.target: VMs can be managed using a browser-based portal, command-line tools with support for scripting, or directly through the REST API.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft partners such as RightScale and ScaleXtreme also provide management services that rely on the REST API.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft partners such as RightScale and ScaleXtreme also provide management services that rely on the REST API.

trans-unit.source: Along with the OS, other configuration choices you have with VMs include:
trans-unit.target: Along with the OS, other configuration choices you have with VMs include:

trans-unit.source: The size, which determines factors such as how many disks you can attach and the processing power.
trans-unit.target: The size, which determines factors such as how many disks you can attach and the processing power.

trans-unit.source: Azure offers a wide variety of sizes to support many types of uses.
trans-unit.target: Azure offers a wide variety of sizes to support many types of uses.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Sizes for Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-size-specs.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Sizes for Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-size-specs.md).

trans-unit.source: The Azure region where your new VM will be hosted, such as in the US, Europe, or Asia.
trans-unit.target: The Azure region where your new VM will be hosted, such as in the US, Europe, or Asia.

trans-unit.source: VM extensions, which give your virtual machine additional capabilities, such as running anti-virus or using the Desired State Configuration feature of Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: VM extensions, which give your virtual machine additional capabilities, such as running anti-virus or using the Desired State Configuration feature of Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Other benefits to consider for VMs include:
trans-unit.target: Other benefits to consider for VMs include:

trans-unit.source: **Pay-as-you-go** -- Azure charges an hourly price based on the VM’s size and operating system.
trans-unit.target: **Pay-as-you-go** -- Azure charges an hourly price based on the VM’s size and operating system.

trans-unit.source: For partial hours, Azure charges only for the minutes of use.
trans-unit.target: For partial hours, Azure charges only for the minutes of use.

trans-unit.source: Storage is priced and charged separately.
trans-unit.target: Storage is priced and charged separately.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Virtual Machines Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/virtual-machines/).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Virtual Machines Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/virtual-machines/).

trans-unit.source: **Resiliency** -- Azure monitors the physical hardware that hosts each running VM.
trans-unit.target: **Resiliency** -- Azure monitors the physical hardware that hosts each running VM.

trans-unit.source: If a physical server running a VM fails, Azure notices this, moves the VM to new hardware and restarts the VM.
trans-unit.target: If a physical server running a VM fails, Azure notices this, moves the VM to new hardware and restarts the VM.

trans-unit.source: This process is sometimes called service healing.
trans-unit.target: This process is sometimes called service healing.

trans-unit.source: Azure also protects a virtual machine's data, by keeping redundant copies of the VHDs in blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Azure also protects a virtual machine's data, by keeping redundant copies of the VHDs in blob storage.
